title: Urban Waste Collection and Recycling Drop-Off
content: A city sanitation department operates trucks to collect household waste (linehaul) and transport recyclables (backhaul) to processing centers. Trucks must complete all waste collections before recyclable pickups and return to the depot only if necessary (open routes). Each route is limited to <time_limit> hours to ensure shifts end on time. Optimize routes to minimize total distance while balancing workload across trucks.

```  
content:
Marine conservationists coordinate:  
- Delivery of nursery-grown coral fragments (<demand_linehaul>) to restoration sites  
- Collection of damaged coral specimens (<demand_backhaul>) for lab analysis  
Boats (<capacity>) face <time_limit> constraints due to diving safety protocols. All deliveries must precede collections, with vessels remaining at the last research site.

title: Mobile Medical Waste Collection and Vaccine Delivery
content: A healthcare provider operates a fleet of refrigerated vans to deliver vaccines to clinics (<loc_customer>) while collecting expired medications and medical waste for safe disposal. Each van has a cold storage capacity of <capacity> units and a maximum operational duration of <time_limit> hours. Deliveries (linehaul) must be completed before waste pickups (backhaul) begin. Vans do not return to the depot (<loc_depot>) after their final stop, reducing unnecessary travel.

title: Urban Furniture Rental with Returns and Time-Constrained Routes
content: A furniture rental company delivers items to customers (<loc_customer>) and picks up expired rentals from previous clients in the same trip. Trucks (<capacity>) must complete deliveries before collections (backhaul) and finish routes within <time_limit> hours to meet driver shift limits. Vehicles end routes at the last pickup location, avoiding depot returns.

title: Offshore Wind Turbine Maintenance with Spare Parts and Defect Retrieval
content: Service vessels depart from a coastal base (<loc_depot>) to deliver spare parts to wind turbines (<loc_customer>, linehaul) and retrieve defective components (backhaul). Each vessel has a weight limit of <capacity> tons and must complete trips within <time_limit> hours due to tidal constraints. Vessels remain on-site after final retrievals for crew rotations.

title: Mobile Library Book Rotation with Donation Collection
content: A library system uses vans to distribute books to neighborhood hubs (<loc_customer>, linehaul) and collect donated books (backhaul). Vans (<capacity>) operate for a maximum of <time_limit> hours daily. Deliveries are prioritized before pickups, and vans park at the final donation point overnight.

title: Industrial Gas Cylinder Exchange with Duration-Limited Routes
content: A gas supplier swaps full cylinders (linehaul) for empty ones (backhaul) at factories (<loc_customer>). Trucks (<capacity>) must complete deliveries before pickups and finish routes within <time_limit> hours to comply with hazardous material regulations. Drivers end shifts at the last factory, leaving trucks for local refilling.

title: Mobile EV Charging and Battery Swap Logistics
content: A fleet of mobile charging trucks operates in a metropolitan area to service electric vehicles (EVs) with depleted batteries. Each truck starts at a central depot (<loc_depot>) with fully charged batteries (<capacity> units) and visits EV owners (<loc_customer>) to either deliver fresh batteries (<demand_linehaul>) or collect depleted ones (<demand_backhaul>). Trucks must complete all deliveries before pickups and finish routes at their last stop (no return). Due to shift limits, each route cannot exceed <time_limit> hours.

title: Urban Tree Trimming and Biomass Recycling
content: A city parks department dispatches trucks from a nursery (<loc_depot>) to trim overgrown trees at <num_customer> locations (<loc_customer>). Each truck carries tools (<demand_linehaul>) and has a <capacity> for hauling away branches. After servicing a location, crews load biomass (<demand_backhaul>) for recycling. Routes must prioritize tool deliveries before collections and end at the final worksite. Daily shifts are capped at <time_limit> hours to comply with labor laws.

title: Floating Solar Panel Maintenance and Defect Retrieval
content: Technicians use boats to maintain offshore solar farms, starting from a coastal base (<loc_depot>). Each boat carries replacement panels (<demand_linehaul>) and can transport up to <capacity> defective panels (<demand_backhaul>). Deliveries must precede pickups, and boats remain onsite after final repairs. Due to daylight constraints, routes are limited to <time_limit> hours.

title: Temporary Art Installation Logistics
content: An art collective transports installations (<demand_linehaul>) from a studio (<loc_depot>) to <num_customer> festival sites (<loc_customer>) using vans (<capacity>). After events, they collect installations (<demand_backhaul>) for storage. Vans must deliver all art before retrievals and finish routes at the last venue. Battery limits in electric vans restrict routes to <distance_limit> km.

title: Antarctic Research Equipment Rotation
content: A supply ship stationed at <loc_depot> services <num_customer> research outposts (<loc_customer>) with fresh equipment (<demand_linehaul>) while retrieving broken gear (<demand_backhaul>). Ships must complete deliveries before loading returns and remain at the final outpost due to ice conditions. Fuel constraints limit each route to <time_limit> hours of operation.

title: Mobile EV Charging Station Deployment and Battery Collection
content: A fleet of mobile charging trucks operates in a metropolitan area, delivering charged batteries to electric vehicle (EV) charging stations (<loc_customer>) while collecting depleted ones for recharging. Each truck starts at the depot (<loc_depot>) with a capacity of <capacity> batteries. Deliveries (linehaul) must precede pickups (backhaul), and routes cannot exceed <time_limit> hours due to battery swap schedules. The goal is to minimize total distance while ensuring all stations receive fresh batteries and depleted ones are collected efficiently.

title: Urban Vertical Farm Harvesting and Compost Delivery
content: A network of rooftop farms (<loc_customer>) requires weekly harvest collection (backhaul) and compost delivery (linehaul) from a central processing facility (<loc_depot>). Trucks with <capacity> kg capacity must deliver compost before collecting produce to prevent contamination. Routes are limited to <time_limit> hours to maintain produce freshness. Optimize routes to minimize travel time while balancing delivery/pickup loads across the fleet.

title: Offshore Research Buoy Maintenance and Data Retrieval
content: Scientific buoys (<loc_customer>) in coastal waters require periodic servicing from a shore base (<loc_depot>). Service vessels (<capacity> kg payload) must deliver fresh instruments (linehaul) before retrieving data modules (backhaul). Due to fuel constraints, each route cannot exceed <distance_limit> nautical miles. Plan routes to service all buoys while minimizing total fleet operating time.

title: Temporary Event Generator Fueling and Waste Oil Collection
content: During a multi-day festival, generators at vendor sites (<loc_customer>) need diesel deliveries (linehaul) and waste oil pickups (backhaul) from a central depot (<loc_depot>). Tanker trucks (<capacity> liters) must complete all deliveries before collections to prevent cross-contamination. Each route is limited to <time_limit> hours due to generator maintenance schedules. Optimize for minimal total distance while meeting all fueling needs.

title: Urban Tree Nursery Rotation and Soil Replenishment
content: A municipal nursery (<loc_depot>) rotates mature trees to parks (<loc_customer>, linehaul) while collecting depleted soil from planting sites (backhaul). Flatbed trucks (<capacity> tons) must deliver all trees before collecting soil. Routes cannot exceed <time_limit> hours to align with park staff availability. Design routes that minimize deadhead mileage while ensuring all locations receive trees and depleted soil is recycled.

title: Mobile EV Charging Station Deployment and Battery Collection
content:
A city deploys mobile electric vehicle (EV) charging stations to underserved neighborhoods (<loc_customer>) from a central depot (<loc_depot>). Each station requires delivery of charged battery packs (<demand_linehaul>) and collects depleted ones (<demand_backhaul>). Service vehicles (<capacity>) have 8-hour shifts (<time_limit>) and end routes at final locations. The challenge is to maximize coverage while ensuring:  
- Battery swaps precede collections on each route  
- No vehicle exceeds weight limits during simultaneous deliveries/pickups  
- All routes complete within shift durations  
```

```
**Scenario 2:** Offshore Aquaculture Feed Delivery and Harvest Collection  
A fish farming operation services sea cages (<loc_customer>) from a coastal base (<loc_depot>). Supply boats (<capacity>) must:  
1. Deliver feed sacks (<demand_linehaul>)  
2. Collect harvested fish (<demand_backhaul>)  
3. Complete routes within tidal windows (<time_limit>)  
Boats remain at final cage locations overnight. Constraints include:  
- Feed must be delivered before harvest collection  
- Weight distribution limits change as cargo shifts from feed to fish  
- Routes adapt to daily tidal access periods  
```

```
**Scenario 3:** Urban Tree Maintenance and Biomass Recycling  
A municipal arborist team services trees (<loc_customer>) from a nursery (<loc_depot>) using chipper trucks (<capacity>). Each route must:  
- Deliver fresh saplings/soil (<demand_linehaul>)  
- Collect pruned branches (<demand_backhaul>)  
- Finish within 6-hour work blocks (<time_limit>)  
Trucks park overnight at final job sites. Key considerations:  
- Delivery materials must be unloaded before collecting green waste  
- Bulk density differences between soil (heavy) and chips (light) affect capacity  
- Routes balance travel time with on-site work duration  
```

```
**Scenario 4:** Film Location Catering with Equipment Rotation  
A movie production moves between shooting sites (<loc_customer>) from a base camp (<loc_depot>). Catering trucks (<capacity>) must:  
- Deliver fresh meals (<demand_linehaul>)  
- Return used serviceware (<demand_backhaul>)  
- Complete routes during 3-hour meal breaks (<time_limit>)  
Vehicles stay at final locations for next service. Challenges include:  
- Food delivery must precede dirty dish collection  
- Temperature-controlled compartments reduce available capacity  
- Strict schedule adherence to avoid disrupting filming  
```

```
**Scenario 5:** Antarctic Research Equipment Rotation  
A science station (<loc_depot>) services field camps (<loc_customer>) using tracked vehicles (<capacity>). Each trip must:  
- Deploy sensitive instruments (<demand_linehaul>)  
- Retrieve collected samples (<demand_backhaul>)  
- Finish within 12-hour operational windows (<time_limit>)  
Vehicles remain at terminal camps due to extreme weather. Constraints involve:  
- Instrument setup precedes sample collection  
- Vehicle weight limits decrease in soft snow conditions  
- Routes must avoid crevasse zones, extending effective distances  
```

These scenarios emphasize:  
1) **Clear backhaul separation** (deliveries before pickups)  
2) **Duration-bound operations** (shift/time window limits)  
3) **Open-ended routes** (vehicles don't return to depot)  
4) **Capacity management** with changing load characteristics  
5) **Domain-specific constraints** without time windows

title: Mobile EV Battery Swap and Depleted Battery Collection
content: A fleet of service vans operates a battery-swapping program for electric vehicles (EVs) in urban areas. Each van starts at a central depot (<loc_depot>) with fresh batteries (<demand_linehaul>) and visits EV charging stations (<loc_customer>) to replace depleted batteries (<demand_backhaul>). Vans have limited cargo space (<capacity>) and must complete routes within <time_limit> hours due to shift constraints. Deliveries must precede pickups, and vans may end routes at their final station without returning to the depot.

title: Offshore Research Buoy Maintenance and Data Retrieval
content: A research vessel services oceanographic buoys (<loc_customer>) deployed across a marine reserve. The vessel departs from a coastal base (<loc_depot>), delivers fresh sensors (<demand_linehaul>), and retrieves data modules (<demand_backhaul>). Due to fuel constraints, each route must finish within <distance_limit> nautical miles. The vessel cannot mix deliveries and pickups and may conclude operations at the last buoy serviced.

title: Urban Green Waste Collection and Compost Delivery
content: A municipal truck fleet manages a circular economy program: delivering compost (<demand_linehaul>) to community gardens (<loc_customer>) and collecting green waste (<demand_backhaul>) for recycling. Trucks (<capacity>) must complete routes within <time_limit> hours to meet processing facility schedules. Deliveries are prioritized before collections, and trucks may park at the final garden after service.

title: Industrial Tool Rental Fleet Redistribution
content: A tool rental company rebalances equipment across depots (<loc_customer>) from a central hub (<loc_depot>). Vans transport high-demand tools (<demand_linehaul>) to understocked locations and retrieve underutilized items (<demand_backhaul>). Each van operates within a <distance_limit> km range due to maintenance intervals and must complete deliveries before pickups. Routes terminate at the last depot serviced.

title: Antarctic Research Station Supply Chain
content: A snowmobile team resupplies remote field stations (<loc_customer>) from a main base (<loc_depot>), delivering fuel/equipment (<demand_linehaul>) and collecting ice core samples (<demand_backhaul>). Vehicles (<capacity>) face strict <time_limit> constraints due to extreme weather. Samples can only be collected after deliveries, and routes may end at the final station to minimize exposure risks.

title: Mobile EV Charging and Battery Swap Logistics
content: A fleet of mobile charging vans operates in a metropolitan area to service electric vehicles (EVs) with depleted batteries. Each van starts at a central depot (<loc_depot>) with fully charged batteries (<capacity> kWh) and visits EV owners (<loc_customer>) to either swap depleted batteries (<demand_backhaul>) or deliver charged ones (<demand_linehaul>). Vans must complete all deliveries before collecting depleted batteries and cannot exceed their energy capacity. Routes are constrained by a <time_limit> to ensure timely service, and vans may end their shift at their final stop (open routes).

title: Offshore Aquaculture Feed Delivery and Waste Collection
content: A marine farming company uses boats to distribute feed (<demand_linehaul>) to fish pens (<loc_customer>) and collect organic waste (<demand_backhaul>) for composting. Boats depart from a coastal hub (<loc_depot>) with a <capacity> ton limit and must prioritize feed deliveries before waste pickups. Each route must finish within <time_limit> hours due to tidal conditions, and boats may dock at nearby ports after their last stop (open routes).

title: Urban Furniture Rental with Returns and Time-Constrained Routes
content: A furniture rental company manages same-day deliveries (<demand_linehaul>) and pickups (<demand_backhaul>) for customers (<loc_customer>) using trucks (<capacity>) from a warehouse (<loc_depot>). Deliveries must precede pickups, and each truck’s route cannot exceed <time_limit> hours to meet customer availability. Trucks may park at designated zones after final pickups (open routes), optimizing for minimal distance while balancing workload across vehicles.

title: Antarctic Research Equipment Rotation and Waste Evacuation
content: A research team shuttles equipment (<demand_linehaul>) from a base station (<loc_depot>) to remote field sites (<loc_customer>) and retrieves broken gear (<demand_backhaul>) using snowmobiles with <capacity> limits. Routes are constrained by <time_limit> hours due to extreme weather, and snowmobiles may remain at the last site (open routes). The goal is to minimize travel distance while ensuring no overloading and timely waste removal.

title: Industrial Gas Cylinder Exchange with Duration-Limited Routes
content: A gas supplier swaps empty cylinders (<demand_backhaul>) for full ones (<demand_linehaul>) at factories (<loc_customer>) using trucks (<capacity>) from a depot (<loc_depot>). Deliveries must precede pickups, and each route is capped at <time_limit> hours to comply with driver shifts. Trucks may end routes at the last factory (open routes), prioritizing efficient cylinder redistribution without exceeding capacity.
